grading_system.description: No grading system details found in official sources - unable to verify if letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail system is used

inspection_details.frequency: Minimum of two (2) times a year for routine inspection
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Serious violations trigger re-inspection date setup
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Food inspection reports available for area food facilities - specific posting requirements not detailed

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Multiple local Fire Protection Districts and Community Service Districts - 14 total agencies
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems must have inspections every six months by licensed fire protection company per NFPA 96

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (Cal Code), effective January 2019
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by Environmental Health Specialists
permit_types: California Food Handler Card (required for all food prep/service employees)

confidence_notes: While basic inspection frequency and food code basis are verified, critical details about grading methodology, scoring systems, and specific fire marshal authority are not available in official sources
verification_notes: Direct contact with Plumas County Environmental Health at (530) 283-6355 needed to verify: 1) Specific grading/scoring system used 2) Letter grades vs numerical scores vs pass/fail 3) Inspection report posting requirements 4) Which specific fire districts have authority over commercial kitchen inspections 5) Local ordinances beyond state code
